metadata.synopsis: Boasting crooks threeway dialog. Earspoon, a Rivington Rat, and Borgus, a Zhentarim smuggler, are chatting over dice.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *The two men bark softly to each other. A single name reaches your ears: 'Nine-Fingers'.*

46.speaker: Player
46.text: *It's a name you know. Nine-Fingers is the head of the Guild, a criminal organisation operating inside Baldur's Gate.*

69.speaker: Player
69.text: *It's a name you know. Nine-Fingers is the head of the Guild, a criminal organisation operating inside Baldur's Gate.*

41.speaker: Player
41.text: *It's a name you know. Nine-Fingers is the head of the Guild, a criminal organisation operating inside Baldur's Gate.*

71.text: *It's a name you know. Nine-Fingers is the head of the Guild, a criminal organisation operating inside Baldur's Gate.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *It's a name you know. Nine-Fingers is the head of the Guild, a criminal organisation operating inside Baldur's Gate.*

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Talking about Nine-Fingers? I've got business with her.

76.speaker: Earspoon
76.text: Oh yeah? Seems everyone's got business with her. Heard the gal met her match.

27.speaker: Borgus Elamin
27.text: Oh yeah? Seems everyone's got business with her. Heard the gal met her match.

35.speaker: Earspoon
35.text: Hey, you still lurking about? I don't remember inviting you to the party.

16.text: Don't know who you're talking about. So clear out, hm?

75.speaker: Earspoon
75.text: Don't know who you're talking about. So clear out, hm?

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: You Rats with the Guild now? Heard Nine-Fingers met her match.

64.speaker: Borgus Elamin
64.text: You Rats with the Guild now? Heard Nine-Fingers met her match.

5.speaker: Earspoon
5.text: The new kingpin? All meat and muscle, that one. And wild as a werebear. If he's looking to oust Nine-Fingers, my blade's got his back.

29.speaker: Borgus Elamin
29.text: Sounds messy as the ninth hell. Must be why she called us to help.

48.speaker: Earspoon
48.text: Is that right? The way I heard it, you Zhent cut a deal with the new... hold on.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Borgus, but then noticing player is listening in

73.speaker: Earspoon
73.text: You there - getting up in our affairs?
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player, who is caught eavedropping

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I need to talk to Nine-Fingers about Zenovia.

3.speaker: Earspoon
3.text: Hmm. Better you than me. Now listen - I'll only say this once:

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Come on, level with me. I'm not about to sell out another dwarf.

53.speaker: Borgus Elamin
53.text: All the dwarf sellouts I know would disagree.

72.text: All the dwarf sellouts I know would disagree.

26.speaker: Borgus Elamin
26.text: All the dwarf sellouts I know would disagree.

12.speaker: Borgus Elamin
12.text: Now cut out. This here's a private function.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I bet a few coins would loosen your tongue. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

14.speaker: Earspoon
14.text: Nice - I promise I'll put it to good use.

54.speaker: Earspoon
54.text: Now, this subject's not safe, so listen close - I'm only saying it once:

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I'm short on gold, I'm afraid.

34.text: My tongue's not for sale. Now scram - this conversation's done, over, finished.

36.speaker: Borgus Elamin
36.text: My tongue's not for sale. Now scram - this conversation's done, over, finished.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I'm looking to join the Guild. How about you point me the way?

24.speaker: Earspoon
24.text: Stick my neck out for a duergar? Not happening.

45.text: Stick my neck out for a duergar? Not happening.

37.speaker: Earspoon
37.text: And risk my neck? I don't think so.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Sounds like an interesting business. I'd like to take part.

42.speaker: Earspoon
42.text: Look - this subject's not safe. You selling your services, beat feet to the Guild hall.

58.speaker: Earspoon
58.text: Look - this subject's not safe. You selling your services, beat feet to the Guild hall.

51.speaker: Earspoon
51.text: Lower City. Basilisk Gate. Guildhall. And that's all you're getting from me.

15.speaker: Earspoon
15.text: Now scram. The chat's officially closed.

60.text: Good luck with that, chum. My mouth's buttoned.

17.speaker: Earspoon
17.text: Good luck with that, chum. My mouth's buttoned.

70.speaker: Earspoon
70.text: Nine-Fingers won't be happy about Zenovia. And I'm not about to tell her.

19.speaker: Earspoon
19.text: Nine-Fingers won't be happy about Zenovia. And I'm not about to tell her.

38.text: Hey Borgus - this snooper's up in my brain. Time he learns a thing or two!

68.speaker: Earspoon
68.text: Hey Borgus - this snooper's up in my brain. Time they learn a thing or two!

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I need work, and it sounds like Nine-Fingers needs steel.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: And? You're airing private matters in a brothel.

4.speaker: Borgus Elamin
4.text: Heh - they've got you there, Spoon.

49.speaker: Earspoon
49.text: Don't matter - this discussion doesn't concern you. So why don't you make tracks?

47.text: *No matter how hard you concentrate, you can make no sense of their conversation.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *No matter how hard you concentrate, you can make no sense of their conversation.*
